TRON DAO ผลักดันการอภิปรายเรื่อง stablecoin ในงานประชุม Digital Assets at Duke

TRON DAO advances stablecoin dialogue at digital assets at Duke Conference

8h ago//Estefano Gomez
regulation
AI

Summary

TH

TRON DAO เข้าร่วมงาน Digital Assets at Duke Conference ในฐานะ Gold Tier Sponsor เพื่อส่งเสริมการอภิปรายเกี่ยวกับการนำร่องและกฎระเบียบของสินทรัพย์ดิจิทัล จุดเด่นของงานคือการอภิปรายในพาเนลหัวข้อ "Stablecoins" โดยมี Sam Elfarra โฆษกของ TRON DAO ร่วมกับผู้บริหารจาก Circle, Stripe และ Stellar Development Foundation การสนทนามุ่งเน้นไปที่การใช้ stablecoins ในกระแสหลักสำหรับการชำระเงิน ความหลากหลายของผู้ออกสกุลเงิน และกรอบกฎระเบียบที่มีผลต่ออุตสาหกรรม ในระหว่างงาน Elfarra ได้เน้นย้ำว่าโครงสร้างพื้นฐาน blockchain ที่ขยายได้และมีต้นทุนต่ำนั้นเป็นสิ่งสำคัญต่ออนาคตของระบบการเงินโลก พร้อมยืนยันความมุ่งมั่นของ TRON ในการมีส่วนร่วมด้านนโยบายและบทบาทของเครือข่ายในฐานะแพลตฟอร์มชั้นนำสำหรับการชำระเงิน stablecoins TRON DAO ยังคงแสดงการเติบโตอย่างต่อเนื่องด้วยจำนวนผู้ใช้งานมากกว่า 363 ล้านบัญชี และเป็นเจ้าภาพของ USD Tether (USDT) จำนวนมหาศาล

EN

TRON DAO recently participated as a Gold Tier Sponsor at the Digital Assets at Duke Conference, held at Duke University, to promote dialogue on the adoption and regulation of digital assets. A key highlight was the "Stablecoins" panel, featuring Sam Elfarra, Community Spokesperson at TRON DAO, alongside executives from Circle, Stripe, and the Stellar Development Foundation. The discussion focused on the mainstream use of stablecoins for payments, the diversification of issuers, and the evolving regulatory frameworks impacting the industry. During the event, Elfarra emphasized that scalable and low-cost blockchain infrastructure is essential for the future of global financial systems. He reaffirmed TRON's commitment to policy engagement and its role as a leading network for stablecoin settlement. TRON DAO continues to demonstrate significant ecosystem growth, currently boasting over 363 million user accounts and hosting a substantial circulating supply of USD Tether (USDT).

Key Points

  • TRON DAO served as a Gold Tier Sponsor at the Digital Assets at Duke Conference.
  • TRON's Sam Elfarra joined a panel with Circle, Stripe, and Stellar to discuss stablecoin adoption and regulation.
  • TRON highlighted its infrastructure capabilities, noting over 363 million user accounts and a significant USDT supply.

Article

TRON DAO promotes stablecoin dialogue at the Digital Assets at Duke Conference focusing on adoption, regulation, and financial systems. Geneva, Switzerland, January 6, 2026 — TRON DAO , the community-governed DAO dedicated to accelerating the decentralization of the internet through blockchain technology and decentralized applications (dApps), successfully wrapped up its participation as a Gold Tier Sponsor at the Digital Assets at Duke Conference, held February 4–6 at Duke University’s Penn Pavilion in Durham, North Carolina. The annual conference convened over 200 leading voices from finance, policy, academia, and technology for in-depth discussions on the rapidly evolving digital asset landscape. The TRON DAO team convened at the welcome reception hosted by Fidelity on Day 1, connecting with conference participants and industry leaders. On Day 2 of the conference, Sam Elfarra, Community Spokesperson at the TRON DAO, joined a high-level panel titled “Stablecoins,” moderated by Lee Reiners, Lecturing Fellow at the Duke Financial Economics Center. Elfarra was joined by Corey Then, Vice President of Global Policy at Circle; Sam Swartz, Head of Central Public Policy at Stripe; and Daniel Casanas, Head of Investments at the Stellar Development Foundation. The panel explored the accelerating adoption of stablecoins as mainstream payment and settlement tools across trading platforms, payment networks, and corporate treasuries. Panelists examined the growing diversity of stablecoin issuers from fintech startups to traditional financial institutions, the expansion of reserve models, and the evolving regulatory frameworks shaping stablecoin design and growth. “Scalable, low-cost blockchain infrastructure is foundational to the next generation of global financial systems,” said Elfarra. “As a leading network for stablecoin settlement and real-world adoption, TRON is committed to constructive policy engagement and collaboration with academic and institutional stakeholders.” After the panel, the team also attended a Fireside Chat with Crypto in America and Bo Hines, featuring timely discussions on the evolving digital asset landscape and stablecoin adoption. Through its participation at the Digital Assets at Duke Conference, TRON DAO reinforced its commitment to engaging with policymakers, academics, and industry leaders on shaping the future of digital finance. For more information about TRON’s initiatives and upcoming events, please visit TRON DAO’s official website . About TRON DAO TRON DAO is a community-governed DAO dedicated to accelerating the decentralization of the internet via blockchain technology and dApps. Founded in September 2017 by H.E. Justin Sun, the TRON blockchain has experienced significant growth since its MainNet launch in May 2018. Until recently, TRON hosted the largest circulating supply of USD Tether (USDT) stablecoin, which currently exceeds $83 billion. As of February 2026, the TRON blockchain has recorded over 363 million in total user accounts, more than 12 billion in total transactions, and over $23 billion in total value locked (TVL), based on TRONSCAN. Recognized as the global settlement layer for stablecoin transactions and everyday purchases with proven success, TRON is “Moving Trillions, Empowering Billions.” TRONNetwork | TRONDAO | X | YouTube | Telegram | Discord | Reddit | GitHub | Medium | Forum Media Contact Yeweon Park [email protected]
